features.desc: A black seal to the left of the portrait bears the name of the distributing Federal Reserve Bank.
features.label: Black seal

features.desc: Move your finger along the note’s surface to feel the raised printing, which gives genuine Federal Reserve notes their distinctive texture.
features.label: Raised printing

features.desc: Federal Reserve note paper is one-fourth linen and three-fourths cotton, and contains red and blue security fibers.
features.label: Paper

features.desc: The $20 note features a portrait of President Jackson on the front of the note. The vignette on the back of the note features the White House.
features.label: Portrait and vignette

features.desc: A seal to the right of the portrait represents the U.S. Department of the Treasury.
features.label: Green Seal

features.desc: A combination of numbers and letters appears twice on the front of the note.
features.label: Serial numbers

possibleDefects.desc: The seal of the Federal Reserve Bank is wrong or is not in the right place.
possibleDefects.label: Black seal

possibleDefects.desc: The note doesn't have raised printing on the surface.
possibleDefects.label: Raised printing

possibleDefects.desc: The papel is wrong or doesn't contain small red and blue fibers.
possibleDefects.label: Paper

possibleDefects.desc: The portrait or the vignette are wrong.
possibleDefects.label: Portrait and vignette

features.desc: A black seal to the left of the portrait which bears the name and corresponding letter of the distributing Federal Reserve Bank.
features.label: Black seal

features.desc: Move your finger along the note’s surface to feel the raised printing, which gives genuine Federal Reserve notes their distinctive texture.
features.label: Raised printing

features.desc: Federal Reserve note paper is one-fourth linen and three-fourths cotton, and contains red and blue security fibers.
features.label: Paper

features.desc: The $20 note features a portrait of President Jackson on the front of the note. The vignette on the back of the note features the White House.
features.label: Portrait and vignette

features.desc: A seal to the right of the portrait represents the U.S. Department of the Treasury.
features.label: Green Seal

features.desc: A unique combination of eleven numbers and letters appears twice on the front of the note.
features.label: Serial numbers

keyFeatures.desc: Hold the note to light to see an embedded thread running vertically to the left of the Federal Reserve Bank seal. The thread is imprinted with the letters USA and the word TWENTY in an alternating pattern and is visible from both sides of the note. The thread glows green when illuminated by ultraviolet light.
keyFeatures.label: Security thread

keyFeatures.desc: Look carefully (magnification may be necessary) to see the small printed words THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA along the outer edge of the portrait’s oval frame.
keyFeatures.label: Microprinting

possibleDefects.desc: The thread is not embedded, doesn't have the right format or doesn't glow green when illuminated by ultraviolet light.
possibleDefects.label: Security thread

possibleDefects.desc: The small words THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA are not along the outer edge of the portrait’s oval frame, or are badly printed.
possibleDefects.label: Microprinting

possibleDefects.desc: The seal of the Federal Reserve Bank is wrong or is not in the right place.
possibleDefects.label: Black seal

possibleDefects.desc: The note doesn't have raised printing on the surface.
possibleDefects.label: Raised printing

possibleDefects.desc: The papel is wrong or doesn't contain small red and blue fibers.
possibleDefects.label: Paper

possibleDefects.desc: The portrait or the vignette are wrong.
possibleDefects.label: Portrait and vignette

possibleDefects.desc: The seal of the U.S. Department of the Treasury is wrong or isn't in the right place.
possibleDefects.label: Green seal

possibleDefects.desc: The serial numbers are badly printed or don't have the right format.
possibleDefects.label: Serial numbers

features.desc: A black seal to the left of the portrait represents the entire Federal Reserve System. A letter and number beneath the left serial number identifies the distributing Federal Reserve Bank.
features.label: Black seal

features.desc: Look carefully (magnification may be necessary) to see the small printed text USA20 repeated within the numeral in the lower left corner on the front of the note and THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA along the lower edge ornamentation framing the portrait.
features.label: Microprinting

features.desc: Move your finger along the note’s surface to feel the raised printing, which gives genuine Federal Reserve notes their distinctive texture.
features.label: Raised printing

features.desc: Federal Reserve note paper is one-fourth linen and three-fourths cotton, and contains red and blue security fibers.
features.label: Paper

features.desc: The $20 note features a portrait of President Jackson on the front of the note. The vignette on the back of the note features the White House.
features.label: Portrait and vignette

features.desc: A seal to the right of the portrait represents the U.S. Department of the Treasury.
features.label: Green Seal

features.desc: A unique combination of eleven numbers and letters appears twice on the front of the note.
features.label: Serial numbers

keyFeatures.desc: Hold the note to light to see an embedded thread running vertically to the left of the portrait. The thread is imprinted with the text USA TWENTY and a small flag in an alternating pattern and is visible from both sides of the note. The thread glows green when illuminated by ultraviolet light.
keyFeatures.label: Security thread

keyFeatures.desc: Hold the note to light and look for a faint image of President Jackson in the blank space to the right of the portrait. The image is visible from both sides of the note.
keyFeatures.label: Watermark

keyFeatures.desc: Tilt the note to see the numeral 20 in the lower right corner on the front of the note shift from green to black.
keyFeatures.label: Color-shifting ink

possibleDefects.desc: The thread is not embedded, doesn't have the right format or doesn't glow green when illuminated by ultraviolet light.
possibleDefects.label: Security thread

possibleDefects.desc: The watermark is not in the right place, isn't visible from both sides or doesn't match the portrait.
possibleDefects.label: Watermark

possibleDefects.desc: The ink doesn't shift from green to black.
possibleDefects.label: Color-shifting ink

possibleDefects.desc: The seal of the Federal Reserve System is wrong or is not in the right place.
possibleDefects.label: Black seal

possibleDefects.desc: The small text USA20 or THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA are not in the right place or are badly printed.
possibleDefects.label: Microprinting

possibleDefects.label: Raised printing

features.desc: A black seal to the left of the portrait represents the entire Federal Reserve System. A letter and number beneath the left serial number identifies the distributing Federal Reserve Bank.
features.label: Black seal

features.desc: Look carefully (magnification may be necessary) to see the small printed text USA20 along the border of the first three letters of the blue TWENTY USA ribbon to the right of the portrait and THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA 20 USA 20 in black in the border below the Treasurer’s signature.
features.label: Microprinting

features.desc: Move your finger along the note’s surface to feel the raised printing, which gives genuine Federal Reserve notes their distinctive texture.
features.label: Raised printing

features.desc: Federal Reserve note paper is one-fourth linen and three-fourths cotton, and contains red and blue security fibers.
features.label: Paper

features.desc: The note includes background colors of green and peach. The words TWENTY USA have been printed in blue in the background to the right of the portrait.
features.label: Color

features.desc: The $20 note features a portrait of President Jackson on the front of the note. The vignette on the back of the note features the White House.
features.label: Portrait and vignette

features.desc: The large blue eagle in the background to the left of President Jackson’s portrait is representative of those drawn and sculpted during his time period. The smaller metallic green eagle to the lower right of the portrait is a more contemporary engraving.
features.label: Symbols of freedom

features.desc: A seal to the right of the portrait represents the U.S. Department of the Treasury.
features.label: Green Seal

features.desc: A unique combination of eleven numbers and letters appears twice on the front of the note.
features.label: Serial numbers

keyFeatures.desc: Hold the note to light to see an embedded thread running vertically to the left of the portrait. The thread is imprinted with the text USA TWENTY and a small flag in an alternating pattern and is visible from both sides of the note. The thread glows green when illuminated by ultraviolet light.
keyFeatures.label: Security thread

keyFeatures.desc: Hold the note to light and look for a faint image of President Jackson in the blank space to the right of the portrait. The image is visible from both sides of the note.
keyFeatures.label: Watermark

keyFeatures.desc: Tilt the note to see the numeral 20 in the lower right corner on the front of the note shift from copper to green.
keyFeatures.label: Color-shifting ink

possibleDefects.label: Security thread

possibleDefects.desc: The watermark is not in the right place, isn't visible from both sides or doesn't match the portrait.
possibleDefects.label: Watermark

possibleDefects.desc: The ink doesn't shift from copper to green.
possibleDefects.label: Color-shifting ink

possibleDefects.label: Black seal

possibleDefects.desc: Some of the small words are not in the right place or are badly printed.
possibleDefects.label: Microprinting
